paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 variant 999del5, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Women diagnosed with breast cancer in Iceland from 1980-2004

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Deaths, no. (% of all cases) 114 (71.3) among BRCA2 carriers.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Breast cancer, diagnosed at a young age
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Young cases had the lowest proportion of ER+ tumors (60.7%) but the highest proportion of HER2-positive tumors (27.9%).

functional_data.summary: The BRCA2 999del5 variant is associated with increased risk of breast cancer.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, as indicated by the higher prevalence among breast cancer patients.
variants.population_frequency: 0.8% in the general population, 7-8% among breast cancer patients in Iceland.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on population studies and clinical outcomes.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is a founder mutation in the Icelandic population.
key_quotes: The prevalence of the BRCA2 mutation among tested patients <=40 years of age was 21.0%, but it was 5.4% among women diagnosed >40 years of age.
For ER+ cancer, breast cancer-specific 15-year survival was 49.7% among BRCA2-carriers.

tables_processed.table_caption: Clinical characteristics and treatment of patients.
BRCA2 carriers and young non-carrier patients compared with older non-carrier patients stratified by ER status.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from both the main text and tables.
